Class Board

java.lang.Object
grab.szan.boards.Board
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClassicBoard
public abstract class Board extends Object
An abstract class representing a game board. It provides the basic structure and utility methods for managing fields, corners, and directions for movement.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected int
    cols
    The number of columns in the board.
    protected List<List<Field>>
    corners
    A list of corner regions on the board, each corner represented as a list of Fields.
    protected int[][]
    dirs
    Possible directions in which moves can be made.
    protected Field[][]
    fields
    A 2D array of Fields representing the board layout.
    protected HashMap<Integer,List<Integer>>
    playersToCornersMap
    Maps the number of players to the indices of corners that should be used for that number of players.
    protected int
    rows
    The number of rows in the board.

      Possible directions in which moves can be made.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int rows, int cols)
      Constructs a Board with the specified number of rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows
      cols - the number of columns

  • Method Details

    • getAvailableDirections

      public int[][] getAvailableDirections()
      Retrieves the available movement directions on this board.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of integers representing movement vectors

    • generateBoard

      public abstract void generateBoard()
      Abstract method that must be implemented to build the board layout.

    • displayBoard

      public String displayBoard()
      Returns a textual representation of the board. '*' indicates an empty field; a digit indicates a field occupied by the player with that ID. Empty or null fields are represented by spaces.
      Returns:
      a string representing the board

    • getFields

      public Field[][] getFields()
      Gets the entire 2D array of fields for this board.
      Returns:
      the fields array

    • getField

      public Field getField(int row, int col)
      Retrieves a specific field from the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      col - the column index
      Returns:
      the field at (row, col), or null if it does not exist

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Gets the number of rows in the board.
      Returns:
      the number of rows

    • getCols

      public int getCols()
      Gets the number of columns in the board.
      Returns:
      the number of columns

    • getCorner

      public List<Field> getCorner(int i)
      Retrieves the list of fields belonging to a particular corner index.
      Parameters:
      i - the corner index
      Returns:
      the list of fields in that corner

    • getAvailableCorners

      public List<Integer> getAvailableCorners(int numOfPlayers)
      Returns the list of corner indices to be filled for a given number of players.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - the number of players in the game
      Returns:
      a list of corner indices suitable for the specified number of players

    • getReachableFields

      public List<Field> getReachableFields(Field start)
      Generates a list of fields reachable from a given starting field, including direct moves and jumps.
      Parameters:
      start - the starting Field
      Returns:
      a list of reachable Fields
